author: killari.
content: After couple of days thinking, I think this is an impossible task as the leaker can make a new zk circuit (and a new zk proof) that proves that some new set of data matches to the root hash without the users privatekey

author: killari.
content: if you disregard that, you can initially allow everyone to make their own contract, and submit a hash of its to the chain, and when making proofs, you make a proof that says that the zk circuit is one of the hashes provided to the contract (but you dont tell which one)

author: sky.cactus
content: You would need a way to prove that your version of the contract is functionally identical to the other participant's version of the contract.

author: sky.cactus
content: Maybe original contract is mutually shared, then salted, then you generate a proof that your root is the shared contract plus salt?

author: killari.
content: right, you can make zk proof of it in theory

author: sky.cactus
content: You would share the proof of "contract is just X + salt" off-chain, and after Alice, Bob, and Carol confirm they would mutually "start" the on-chain verifier (which would be inactive until all 3 had asserted that they have validated the proof).
